txt.en: Explore the points of interests within Deepscrave.
Explore the points of interests within Deepscrave.
Sometimes referred to as the Pillar of the Mountain, the Berg-beam almost seems to hold the entire cavern ceiling aloft. It was here that most of the common folk of Gundabad built their homes.

Amidst the unfriendly dark of Deepscrave, the Gabil'akkâ have eked out a small place of respite. Aslíf clings to the Berg-beam, as if it is in danger of disappearing into the shadows that surround it.
A waterfall that spills into the depths of Deepscrave. The dwarf-homes that cluster around Buzra-salân are mostly intact, as Orcs have claimed these homes for their own.

Water from the adjacent Gloomingtarn pours onto the ancient water-wheels at Gabil-memâg. During brighter days, the water-wheels powered the lifts of Deepscrave. Now they serve little purpose, cycling endlessly through the ages.
